summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) waiver form for a voluntary employee interview related to an investigation. The form provides warnings and assurances to the employee and includes a waiver section for them to sign, indicating their understanding and willingness to participate. The specific investigation appears to pertain to Jeffrey Epstein, but no detailed content is provided.
keyFacts: The document is an OIG Form 111-226/2 (dated 04/23/07) used for non-custodial employee interviews.
The investigation being conducted by the Office of the Inspector General pertains to Jeffrey Epstein.
The form outlines that the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and any statements may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, acknowledging the warnings and that no promises, threats, pressure, or coercion were used.
